meanings.definition: A feeling of dislike or aversion towards something.
meanings.sent1: Her distastes for spicy food made her avoid anything with chili.
meanings.sent2: His distastes for horror movies meant he always chose comedies instead.
meanings.sent3: The cat's distastes for water led to a hilarious scene when it accidentally fell into the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The artist's distastes for traditional techniques pushed her to experiment with new forms of expression.
meanings.sent5: The child's distastes for vegetables was so strong that he would hide them in his napkin during dinner.

meanings.definition: To have a strong feeling of dislike or aversion towards something.
meanings.sent1: She distastes the bitter taste of coffee and prefers tea instead.
meanings.sent2: He distastes the idea of public speaking and always tries to avoid it.
meanings.sent3: The dog distastes being left alone and will bark until someone comes back.
meanings.sent4: The politician distastes corruption and works tirelessly to fight against it.
meanings.sent5: The student distastes early mornings and struggles to wake up for school every day.
